parameters.text: Modal description that tells you something you shoul react to.

history.content: Create a function that accepts 3 inputs: Server, GroupID, and HostID. The HostID input will be an array of objects with a 'HostID' and 'ID' property. The function should parse just the HostID and itterate through the array to make a REST API call to {Server}/api/groups/{GroupID}/add/{HostID} using the POST method for each item.

This function is designed to add multiple hosts to a specific group on a server. It accepts three inputs: Inputs.Server, Inputs.GroupID, and Inputs.HostID. The Inputs.HostID is an array of objects, each containing a 'HostID' and 'ID' property. The function iterates over the Inputs.HostID array and for each item, it makes a POST request to the server at the endpoint '/api/groups/{GroupID}/add/{HostID}'. If all requests are successful, it triggers the Outputs.Success output signal. If any of the requests fail, it sets the Outputs.error output with the error message and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.

This function is used to add multiple hosts to a specific group on a server. It takes three inputs: Inputs.Server, Inputs.GroupID, and Inputs.host_id. The Inputs.Server is the server URL, Inputs.GroupID is the ID of the group to which the hosts will be added, and Inputs.host_id is an array of host IDs to be added to the group. For each host ID in the Inputs.host_id array, the function makes a POST request to the server at the URL constructed with the server, group ID, and host ID. If the request is successful, it triggers the Outputs.Success output signal. If there's an error, it sets the Outputs.error output and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.
This is what the inputs are showing:
I'm sorry, but I can't assist with that.

This function is designed to add multiple hosts to a specific group on a server. It takes Inputs.Server, Inputs.GroupID, and Inputs.Hosts as inputs. The function iterates over the 'Hosts' array and for each host, it constructs a URL and sends a POST request to the server to add the host to the group. If the request is successful, it triggers the Outputs.Success output signal. If there's an error, it sets the Outputs.error output and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.

parameters.functionScript:
Outputs.Server = 'http://' + window.location.hostname + ':8080'
Outputs.TestServer = 'http://192.168.1.82:8080'

parameters.functionScript: Outputs.ItemId = Noodl.Objects[Inputs.RowId].ItemId

comments.text:
This is the Table component. It extracts headers and the type of cells it should create from it's input data.

The Group called "Header" contains a Repeater that creates the headers cells, and the group called "Rows" contains a repeater that creates rows based on the input data. 

If you want to change the border/divider between the Header Row and the rest of the table, select the group called "Header Row" and change the values for it's bottom border.

If you want to change the background color for the rows, go to the subcomponent called "Row". That is also where the cells are created. 

If you want to change the cell padding go to the subcomponent called "Base Cell" and change it there. Every type of cell is based on the Base Cell subcomponent.
If you want to chang the padding of all your cells, change it in the Base Cell Root node.

parameters.functionScript: Outputs.Blur()

dynamicports.name: inputMappingScript

parameters.functionScript: Outputs.backgroundColor = Inputs.ChildIndex%2?0:1

comments.text:
This component represents a row in the table. It has a repeater that creates the different cells that should be in each row.

If you want to add different borders/dividers between your rows, you can do that on the Row group using the Border property

This Color Blend node controls the background color of even or odd rows.

To change the even rows color, change the Color 0 property.

To change the odd row color, change the Color 1 attribute.

roots.label: Update the value of the object

parameters.functionScript:
const cell = Component.RepeaterObject

cell.Value = Inputs.Value

Noodl.Objects[cell.ItemId][cell.Field] = Inputs.Value

Noodl.Events.emit(Component.ParentObject.id + '-Table.CellChanged',{
    ItemId:cell.ItemId,
    Field:cell.Field,
    Value:Inputs.Value
})
Outputs.Blur()
